item.title: Pranab Mukherjee's daughter takes ‘real rot’ jibe at Congress: ‘Why no CWC…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over CWC Meeting for Her Father's Death

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Sharmistha Mukherjee, daughter of the late former president Pranab Mukherjee, has expressed her dissatisfaction with the Congress party for not convening a Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting to mourn her father’s death in August 2020. She criticized the party’s current state and called for introspection.

  • Mukherjee stated that Congress workers feel alienated from the leadership.
  • She compared the absence of a condolence meeting for her father to past practices regarding deceased leaders.
  • Sharmistha accused Congress of trolling her over her comments about the party’s direction.
  • Her remarks highlight a rift between party ideology and current leadership approaches.
“There is a real rot in the Congress,” said Mukherjee regarding the party's handling of her father's death.

In conclusion, Sharmistha Mukherjee’s comments indicate a significant discontent with the direction of the Congress party and the perceived neglect of traditional practices.

item.title: Delivery Boy To Civil Judge – A Story That Inspires - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Delivery Boy To Civil Judge – A Story That Inspires

Publication Date: 2024
Source: LiveLaw

The inspiring story of Advocate Yaseen Shan Muhammed, who overcame significant hardships to secure the second rank in the Kerala Judicial Services Examinations 2024 and qualify as a Civil Judge.

  • Yaseen faced economic challenges as a child, working various jobs including as a delivery boy.
  • He had limited educational support and was a below-average student early on.
  • After multiple attempts, he cleared the judicial service exam with the help of mentors and guidance.
  • Yaseen emphasizes the importance of hard work and understanding legal material deeply.
  • He aims to represent those from similar disadvantaged backgrounds and wishes to pursue post-graduate studies in law.
“I want to work by being part of the system. I will do my job honestly, sincerely, and as per my conscience.”

Yaseen's story highlights resilience and the role of empowerment in achieving one's dreams.

item.title: 136 Vande Bharat trains serving aspirational Indians with modern comfortable rail travel | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
136 Vande Bharat Trains Transform Indian Rail Travel

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: ANI

Indian Railways has introduced 136 Vande Bharat trains, marking significant modernization in rail travel for India.

  • As of December 26, 2024, 136 Vande Bharat trains are operational.
  • 62 of these services were launched in 2024 alone.
  • Features include Kavach technology, accessible toilets, and Braille signage.
  • 3,210 kilometers of rail track electrified in 2024, with 97% of the broad gauge network electrified.
  • 1,337 stations are identified for redevelopment under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme.
  • Indian Railways aims to be a Net Zero Carbon Emitter by 2030.
  • Total capital expenditure for 2024-25 is ₹2,65,200 crores.
  • E-ticketing has reached 86% in reserved sectors.
  • Gati Shakti Multi-Modal Cargo Terminals are being developed at 354 locations.
  • Three Economic Corridors sanctioned in 2024 are under development with a total of 434 projects planned.
“The Vande Bharat trains have become a symbol of India's aspirations for modern, efficient, and comfortable rail travel.”

This initiative by Indian Railways highlights its commitment to modernization and enhancing passenger experience in rail travel.

item.title: ‘Cong creating controversy over Manmohan Singh's funeral', says Union minister Hardeep Puri - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Controversy Erupts Over Manmohan Singh's Funeral, Claims Union Minister Hardeep Puri

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A heated exchange has unfolded between the BJP and Congress regarding the cremation of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who passed away at the age of 92. Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri criticized Congress for allegedly politicizing the situation and establishing a memorial for Singh.

  • Puri accused Congress of creating unnecessary controversy over Singh's funeral arrangements.
  • The former PM was cremated with full state honors at Delhi's Nigambodh Ghat, attended by top dignitaries.
  • Rahul Gandhi expressed that Singh was insulted by the government's arrangements for his last rites.
  • Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma condemned Congress for politicizing the situation.
“Dr. Manmohan Singh, a statesman of unparalleled dignity and intellect, deserved much better... It is deeply disheartening to witness the Congress Party attempting to stir controversy.” - Himanta Biswa Sarma

The exchanges highlight the ongoing political tensions in India, particularly regarding the legacy of Manmohan Singh and how his passing is being handled by different political factions.

item.title: Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) to be inaugurated on April 17, domestic flights from May - The Times of India
item.description:
Navi Mumbai International Airport to Open on April 17 with Domestic Flights Starting in May

Publication Date: April 3, 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) is set to be inaugurated on April 17, and domestic flights will commence in May, marking a significant development in India's aviation sector.

  • The airport will enhance connectivity for citizens in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region.
  • It aims to ease traffic at the existing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport.
  • The project is expected to benefit economic growth in the area, creating jobs and improving local infrastructure.
  • Authorities emphasize the airport’s potential to handle the increasing air travel demand.
"This airport will play a vital role in boosting our local economy and improving accessibility for the citizens." - Airport Authority representative

The NMIA's inauguration is anticipated to significantly improve air travel in the region, providing a much-needed alternative for travelers.

item.title: 'Baseless allegations': BJP hits back at Congress over 'disrespect' to Manmohan Singh charge - The Times of India
item.description:
BJP Responds to Congress Allegations Regarding Manmohan Singh

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has issued a strong response to allegations made by the Congress party, claiming that the latter has shown disrespect towards former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • The BJP labels the allegations as baseless.
  • Congress accused BJP leaders of disrespecting Singh.
  • The incident escalates the ongoing political tensions between the two parties.
“These allegations are not only unfounded but also reflect the Congress's desperation.” - BJP spokesperson

The BJP's response emphasizes a commitment to respect past leaders, while the Congress continues to assert their claims. The situation highlights the intense political rivalry in the current landscape.

item.title: Boy who fell into borewell in Madhya Pradesh’s Guna dies - The Hindu
item.description:
Boy who fell into borewell in Madhya Pradesh’s Guna dies

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: The Hindu

A tragic incident occurred in Madhya Pradesh’s Guna district where a 10-year-old boy, Sumit Meena, lost his life after falling into a 140-feet borewell. Despite extensive rescue efforts lasting 16 hours, he was declared unresponsive upon retrieval.

  • Sumit fell into the borewell around 5 p.m. on December 28, 2024, in Pipliya village.
  • Rescue operations included the National Disaster Response Force and involved digging a parallel pit.
  • Sumit was trapped at a depth of 39 feet for the entire night before being retrieved.
  • Medical examination indicated he had endured hypothermia and was unresponsive upon being brought out.
  • The borewell had not been properly secured as it did not strike water.
“Sorry to say, he is no more,” Guna district chief medical and health officer Dr. Rajkumar Rishishwar told reporters.

This tragic accident raises concerns regarding child safety and the need for better securing of borewells to prevent similar incidents in the future.

item.title: Four arrested for siphoning off ₹12.5 cr from CRED, Bengaluru police uncover major crime: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Four Arrested for Embezzling ₹12.5 Crore from CRED in Bengaluru

Publication Date: Dec 29, 2024 11:08 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

CRED, a fintech company, uncovered a significant fraud involving ₹12.5 crore during a bank reconciliation on November 13, leading to the arrest of four suspects from Gujarat.

  • The main suspect, Vaibhav Pitadiya, exploited his bank position.
  • Fraudulent activities involved forging Corporate Internet Banking documents.
  • Authorities recovered ₹1.83 crore of the stolen amount.
  • Seventeen unauthorized transactions occurred from October 29 to November 11.
  • The investigation continues to identify further accomplices.
"The investigation is ongoing, with efforts underway to recover the remaining stolen funds and identify any additional accomplices."

This incident highlights vulnerabilities in cybersecurity and the importance of routine audits in financial institutions.

item.title: 10-year-old boy rescued after falling into 140-foot borewell in Madhya Pradesh - The Times of India
item.description:
10-Year-Old Boy Dies After Borewell Rescue in Madhya Pradesh

Date: October 2023 Source: Local News

The tragic incident occurred shortly after the boy was rescued from a borewell in Madhya Pradesh, highlighting the dangers associated with such accidents.

  • A 10-year-old boy was rescued from a borewell.
  • Despite rescue efforts, he died shortly afterward.
  • The incident raises concerns about child safety in rural areas.
  • Rescue operations involved local authorities and emergency services.
“This incident is a heartbreaking reminder of the risks that children face.”

The community is grieving, and discussions on improving safety measures around borewells are expected to follow the incident.

item.title: Perplexity AI CEO meets PM Modi for a ‘great conversation’; netizens wonder ‘Is this AI generated?’ | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Perplexity AI CEO meets PM Modi for a ‘great conversation’

Publication Date: [Insert publication date here] Source: [Insert source here]

Perplexity AI CEO Aravind Srinivas held a significant meeting with Prime Minister Modi to discuss artificial intelligence adoption both in India and globally.

  • Aravind Srinivas shared details of the meeting on his X (formerly Twitter) account, expressing his admiration for PM Modi's vision and dedication to AI.
  • PM Modi acknowledged Srinivas' work and the importance of discussions on AI.
  • Netizens reacted with mixed feelings, some humorously speculating about the authenticity of an image from the meeting.
  • Srinivas advocated for expanded access to Perplexity Pro for Indian students through a partnership with the Indian government.
“Had the honor to meet Prime Minister @narendramodi ji. We had a great conversation about the potential for AI adoption in India and across the world.” - Aravind Srinivas

The meeting underscores the growing discourse on AI in India, with figures from the tech industry engaging with top government officials to explore its potential.

item.title: BPSC rules out 70th CCE re-exam in the entire state, says there is no basis - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BPSC Rules Out Statewide Re-Exam for 70th CCE Due to Insufficient Evidence

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) announced it will not conduct a re-examination for the 70th Combined Competitive Preliminary Examination (CCE Prelims) statewide, citing no basis or evidence for such a decision.

  • BPSC stated that decisions about re-tests are made based on reports from district officers.
  • No reports or evidence have been submitted to justify a re-examination, according to BPSC's exam controller.
  • Only one exam centre (Bapu exam centre in Patna) faced issues that warranted attention.
  • The commission faces protests demanding a revocation of the CCE Preliminary exam results due to alleged irregularities.
  • Political figures express support for the protesters who have been demonstrating for over a week.
“As far as the question of conducting re-examination…it is clarified that neither any report has been made available before the commission by any district officer nor any evidence/proof has been received.” - Rajesh Kumar, BPSC's exam controller

This decision comes amidst ongoing protests and concerns regarding the integrity of the examination process.

item.title: IMD Issues Cold Wave Alert For North India; Dense Fog Reduces Visibility In Delhi, Other Cities - News18
item.description:
IMD Issues Cold Wave Alert For North India; Dense Fog Reduces Visibility In Delhi, Other Cities

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: News18

The India Meteorological Department has issued a warning for cold wave conditions in north India, starting December 29, with temperatures expected to fall significantly.

  • Cold wave conditions expected to affect northern states including Punjab, Haryana, and Himachal Pradesh from December 29 to January 3, 2025.
  • Dense fog predicted to reduce visibility in Delhi and other parts of northern India until December 30, with very dense fog anticipated on December 29 and 30.
  • Temperatures are expected to hover around 5 degrees Celsius in Delhi.
  • The western disturbance near Pakistan is likely to affect the western Himalayan region from January 1 to 6, 2025.
“The weather bureau has predicted dense to very dense fog conditions in various states, including Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Bihar.”

This alert indicates potentially severe weather conditions impacting millions in the region, requiring caution and preparedness from residents and authorities alike.

item.title: Maharashtra horror: Man sets wife on fire for giving birth to 3 daughters - The Times of India
item.description:
Maharashtra Horror: Man Sets Wife on Fire for Giving Birth to 3 Daughters

Date: Not Provided
Source: Not Provided

A tragic incident occurred in Maharashtra where a man set his wife ablaze after she gave birth to three daughters, illustrating the deep-seated issues surrounding gender preference in certain communities.

  • The husband reportedly was disappointed over the gender of his children.
  • The incident has sparked outrage over gender discrimination in India.
  • Authorities are investigating the case and looking for legal recourse against the perpetrator.
“This act is a stark reminder of the persistent gender biases that exist in our society,” a local activist stated.

This incident raises alarms about gender-based violence and the urgent need for societal change regarding the value of women and girl children.

item.title: 4 from Gujarat arrested for siphoning off Rs 12.5 cr from Bengaluru-based fintech firm CRED - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Four Arrested for Embezzling Rs 12.5 Crore from Bengaluru Fintech Firm CRED

Published: 29 December 2024, 02:58 IST

Bengaluru police have arrested four individuals from Gujarat for allegedly siphoning off Rs 12.5 crore from CRED by stealing data and forging banking documents.

  • The mastermind, Vaibhav Pitadiya, used his position at Axis Bank to exploit loopholes.
  • The group forged documents to impersonate company officials and initiated fraudulent transactions.
  • Rs 1.83 crore has been recovered so far, with 17 fraudulent transactions identified.
  • The crime was discovered during a routine bank account reconciliation on November 13.
“Neha submitted a fake CIB form along with forged documents to Axis Bank,” said a police officer involved in the case.

This case highlights vulnerabilities in corporate banking and the potential for significant financial crime through data manipulation.

item.title: 4 from Gujarat held in Bengaluru for siphoning off Rs 12.5 cr from fintech firm CRED - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Four Arrested in Bengaluru for Rs 12.5 Crore Fraud Linked to Fintech Firm CRED

Published on: 29 December 2024, 02:58 IST

Bengaluru police have arrested four individuals from Gujarat accused of misappropriating Rs 12.5 crore from the fintech company CRED by stealing data and forging banking documents.

  • The mastermind, Vaibhav Pitadiya, was a relationship manager at Axis Bank and exploited loopholes in the corporate account systems.
  • Shailesh and Shubham created forged documents to open mule accounts, enabling fraudulent transactions.
  • The scam was discovered during a bank reconciliation exercise on November 13, leading CRED to file a complaint with the police.
  • The police have recovered Rs 1.83 crore so far, and investigations revealed multiple fraudulent transactions made to dubious accounts.
“Neha submitted a fake CIB form along with forged documents to Axis Bank in Ankleshwar, Gujarat, requesting for adding another user with a new email and phone number.” - Officer

This incident highlights significant vulnerabilities in corporate banking safety and raises concerns about data security practices.

item.title: Indian-origin CEO of billion-dollar company reveals his ‘great conversation’ with PM Modi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian-origin CEO of billion-dollar company reveals his ‘great conversation’ with PM Modi

Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Aravind Srinivas, co-founder and CEO of billion-dollar AI company Perplexity AI, shared his experience meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He discussed the potential for AI adoption globally and praised Modi’s dedication and vision.

  • Srinivas took to X to share details of his meeting with PM Modi.
  • The conversation centered around AI adoption in India and worldwide.
  • Srinivas expressed admiration for Modi's dedication to staying informed on AI topics.
  • Social media users reacted positively to Srinivas's achievements.
“Modi Ji’s dedication to staying updated on the topic and his remarkable vision for the future.”

This interaction highlights the growing interest and development of AI in India, emphasizing the role of leaders in fostering innovation.

item.title: Indian-origin CEO of billion-dollar company reveals about his ‘great conversation’ with PM Modi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian-origin CEO of billion-dollar company reveals about his ‘great conversation’ with PM Modi

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Aravind Srinivas, the Indian-origin CEO of Perplexity AI, recently met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and shared insights about their conversation, particularly regarding the potential for AI adoption in India and globally.

  • Aravind Srinivas expressed his admiration for PM Modi’s vision and dedication towards AI.
  • The meeting highlighted the importance of advancing AI technology in India.
  • Social media users celebrated the meeting with congratulatory messages to Srinivas.
  • Srinivas co-founded Perplexity AI after working at OpenAI, DeepMind, and Google.
  • He holds degrees from IIT Madras and a PhD from UC Berkeley.
“Modi Ji’s dedication to staying updated on the topic and his remarkable vision for the future.” - Aravind Srinivas

This meeting marks a significant moment for Indian tech, emphasizing the collaboration between leaders in technology and government.

item.title: 'Insult to Manmohan Singh, his community': Rahul Gandhi slams Centre over denial of burial site for former PM - The New Indian Express
item.description:
Rahul Gandhi Criticizes Government for Denying Burial Site to Manmohan Singh

Published on: 29 Dec 2024, 1:53 am

Source: New Delhi

The political dispute regarding the memorial for former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh intensified after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi condemned the government for performing his last rites at Nigambodh Ghat instead of an authorized burial site.

  • Rahul Gandhi labels the government's actions as a "total insult" to Singh.
  • He urges that Singh deserved a memorial that reflects his stature and contributions.
  • The Aam Aadmi Party demands an apology from the government for the treatment of Singh's last rites.
  • Critics highlight the disparity in memorial treatment compared to other former prime ministers.
  • Union Home Minister Amit Shah states that space for a memorial will be allocated later.
“To date, respecting the dignity of all former Prime Ministers, their last rites were performed at authorized burial sites…”

This controversy raises questions about the respect given to former leaders and the implications of political actions in times of national mourning.

item.title: Big day for Navi Mumbai airport as IndiGo jet to land today to test systems - The Times of India
item.description:
Big day for Navi Mumbai airport as IndiGo jet to land today to test systems

Date: October 15, 2023, Source: Times of India

IndiGo's jet is set to land at Navi Mumbai airport today for an important systems test, marking a significant step in the airport's operational verification.

  • The test landing is crucial for the airport's preparations for full operations.
  • IndiGo, one of India's largest airlines, is integral to the airport's future.
  • The successful test could pave the way for the airport to become operational soon.
"This is a pivotal moment for Navi Mumbai and its connectivity. A successful test will demonstrate our readiness for operations." - Airport Authority Official

The anticipation surrounding today's test landing of IndiGo at Navi Mumbai airport signifies a critical advancement in aviation infrastructure in the region.
